Nextract.name: Nextract
Nextract.description: ETL class that all programs start from

Adds two numbers and/or object properties
classitems.name: add

params.name: collection
params.description: The collection to iterate over

params.name: firstPropOrVal
params.description: The 1st value or property to use in this operation

params.name: secondPropOrVal
params.description: The 2nd value or property to use in this operation

params.name: propertyToUpdateOrAdd
params.description:
The object property to update or create with the value
of this operation

return.description: Promise resolved with the updated collection

classitems.description: Concatenates strings and/or object properties
classitems.name: concat

params.description: The collection to iterate over

params.name: propsOrValsToConcat
params.description: An array of strings and/or object properties to concat

params.name: delimiter
params.description: The delimiter to use in between each propsOrValsToConcat

params.name: propertyToUpdateOrAdd
params.description:
The object property to update or create with the value
of this operation

return.description: Promise resolved with the updated collection

classitems.description: Raw query interface for select statements
classitems.name: selectQuery
example: var sql = 'select first_name, last_name, age, salary from users where id = :id';

params.name: dbName
params.description: A database name that matches a object key defined in your Nextract config file

params.name: sql
params.description:
SQL statement to execute. Can be a fully formed SQL select statement or
a parameterized one with ":key" placeholders. If the later, then sqlParams
must be an object of key/values to be replaced.

params.name: sqlParams
params.description: (optional) List of key/value params to be subbed out in a parameterized query

return.description: Promise resolved with an array of database rows that match the given select statement

classitems.description:
Allows you to run an DELETE query against a database using data obtained from previous steps. Runs
a query for each row in the collection.
classitems.name: deleteQuery

params.name: dbName
params.description: A database name that matches a object key defined in your Nextract config file

params.name: tableName
params.description: Table name

params.name: collection
params.description: The collection to iterate on

params.name: matchCriteria
params.description:
Array of objects with key/value params to be subbed out in a
parameterized query. The expected format is  [{ tableColumn: '', comparator: '', collectionField: '' }].

params.name: maxParallelQueries
params.description: (optional) Max number of queries to run in parallel (defaults to 5)

return.description: Promise resolved once all queries have completed

classitems.description:
Allows you to run an UPDATE query against a database using data obtained from previous steps. Runs
a query for each row in the collection.
classitems.name: updateQuery

params.name: dbName
params.description: A database name that matches a object key defined in your Nextract config file

params.name: tableName
params.description: Table name

params.name: collection
params.description: The collection to iterate on

params.name: columnsToUpdate
params.description: Array of property (column) names to use in the UPDATE

params.name: matchCriteria
params.description:
Array of objects with key/value params to be subbed out in a
parameterized query. The expected format is  [{ tableColumn: '', comparator: '', collectionField: '' }].

return.description: Promise resolved with the give collection once all queries have completed

classitems.description:
Insert query for collections. Will insert each collection item into a database table.
Uses batched inserts for performance gains.
classitems.name: insertQuery

params.name: dbName
params.description: A database name that matches a object key defined in your Nextract config file

params.name: tableName
params.description: Table name

params.name: collection
params.description: The collection to iterate on

params.name: columnsToInsert
params.description: Array of property (column) names to use in the INSERT

params.name: batchAmount
params.description: (optional) Number of rows to batch insert (defaults to 1000)

return.description: Promise resolved with the give collection once all queries have completed

classitems.description:
Allows you to run a select query against a database using data obtained from previous steps. Runs
a query for each row in the collection. The collection will be returned with the properties of the
original item data + the properties of the joined data.  Optionally returns all or just matched rows.
classitems.name: joinQuery
example: var joinSQL = 'select first_name, last_name from users where id = :id';

params.name: dbName
params.description: A database name that matches a object key defined in your Nextract config file

params.name: sqlStatment
params.description:
The sql to run for each row in the collection. The WHERE clause should contain
some :propertyName reference to match on against the current row. The query must return only 1 matching row.

params.name: collection
params.description: The collection to iterate on

params.name: returnedUnmatched
params.description:
(optional: defaults to true) Returns all original collection items
will null as the value for properties missed in the join.  If true, then joinColumnsToReturn must be given.

params.name: joinColumnsToReturn
params.description:
A list of the properties to return in the unmatched case. Should
normally match the columns defined in the SELECT clause. Only required if returnedUnmatched is set to true.

return.description: Promise resolved once all queries have completed

classitems.description:
Iterates over elements of collection, returning an array of all elements
that equal the given testValue.
classitems.name: equals

params.name: collection
params.description: The collection to iterate over

params.name: valueToTest
params.description: The value being against during each iteration

params.name: propertyToTest
params.description: The object property name being tested against during each iteration

return.description: Promise resolved with an array of all elements that equal the testValue

classitems.description:
Iterates over elements of collection, returning an array of all elements
that are greater than the given number.
classitems.name: greaterThan

params.name: collection
params.description: The collection to iterate over

params.name: valueToTest
params.description: The value being against during each iteration

params.name: propertyToTest
params.description: The object property name being tested against during each iteration

return.description: Promise resolved with an array of all elements that are greater than the testValue

classitems.description:
Iterates over elements of collection, returning an array of all elements
that are less than the given number.
classitems.name: lessThan

params.name: collection
params.description: The collection to iterate over

params.name: valueToTest
params.description: The value being against during each iteration

params.name: propertyToTest
params.description: The object property name being tested against during each iteration

return.description: Promise resolved with an array of all elements that are less than the testValue

classitems.description:
Creates a duplicate-free version of a collection, using SameValueZero for equality comparisons, in which
only the first occurrence of each element is kept.

For usage reference - https://lodash.com/docs#uniqBy
classitems.name: uniqBy

params.name: collection
params.description: The collection to iterate over

params.name: propertyToTest
params.description: The object property name being tested against during each iteration

return.description: Promise resolved with the new duplicate free array

classitems.description:
Computes the maximum value of array. It accepts iteratee which is invoked for each element in
array to generate the criterion by which the value is ranked. The iteratee is invoked with
one argument: (value).

For usage reference - https://lodash.com/docs#maxBy
classitems.name: maxBy

params.name: collection
params.description: The collection to iterate over

params.name: prop
params.description: The property to use in this operation

return.description: Promise resolved with the maximum value

classitems.description:
Computes the minimum value of array. It accepts iteratee which is invoked for each element in
array to generate the criterion by which the value is ranked. The iteratee is invoked with
one argument: (value).

For usage reference - https://lodash.com/docs#minBy
classitems.name: minBy

params.name: collection
params.description: The collection to iterate over

params.name: prop
params.description: The property to use in this operation

return.description: Promise resolved with the maximum value

classitems.description:
Computes the mean of the values in array. It accepts iteratee which is invoked for each element in
array to generate the criterion by which the value is ranked. The iteratee is invoked with
one argument: (value).

For usage reference - https://lodash.com/docs#maxBy
classitems.name: meanBy

params.name: collection
params.description: The collection to iterate over

params.name: prop
params.description: The property to use in this operation

return.description: Promise resolved with the maximum value

classitems.description:
Computes the sum of the values in array. It accepts iteratee which is invoked for each element
in array to generate the value to be summed. The iteratee is invoked with one argument: (value).

For usage reference - https://lodash.com/docs#maxBy
classitems.name: sumBy

params.name: collection
params.description: The collection to iterate over

params.name: prop
params.description: The property to use in this operation

return.description: Promise resolved with the sum

classitems.description: Make http calls. It supports HTTPS and follows redirects by default.
classitems.name: makeRequest

params.name: requestConfig
params.description:
A request configuration made up of key/value pairs. Wraps
the popular npm request module so any request config supported by this module will work.
See - https://www.npmjs.com/package/request#requestoptions-callback.

return.description: Promise resolved with an object like so { statusCode: 200, body: 'Hello World' }

classitems.description: Used to read files
classitems.name: readFile

params.name: fileType
params.description: Type of file to write; json, csv, or excel

params.name: filePath
params.description: Full path of file to read (include filename and extension)

params.name: parserConfig
params.description:
If fileType is "csv" then you can also pass a
parsing definition to handle the specific needs of your csv. If noe custom parserConfig
is given then a default config of { delimiter: ',', columns: true } is used. The parserConfig
object allow all paser options supported by cvs-parse (http://csv.adaltas.com/parse/).

classitems.description:
Winston logging config
References:
- https://github.com/winstonjs/winston
- http://stackoverflow.com/a/23330037
- http://stackoverflow.com/a/25233851
Used to output files
classitems.name: writeFile

params.name: fileType
params.description: Type of file to write; json, csv, or excel

params.name: data
params.description: An array of objects to be wrtten to the file

params.name: filePath
params.description: Full path of file to write (include filename and extension)

params.name: formattingConfig
params.description:
Object contain config options for the file type being written.
1) If cvs - all options allowed by cvs-stringify (http://csv.adaltas.com/stringify/) are supported
2) If json - the only option is formatting with X number of spaces (e.g.) {spaces: 2}
3) If excel - see https://www.npmjs.com/package/excel4node

classitems.description:
This method is like _.sortBy except that it allows specifying the sort orders of the iteratees to sort by.
If orders is unspecified, all values are sorted in ascending order. Otherwise, specify an order of "desc"
for descending or "asc" for ascending sort order of corresponding values.

For usage reference - https://lodash.com/docs#orderBy
classitems.name: orderBy

return.description: Promise resolved with the new sorted array

classitems.description:
Creates an array of elements, sorted in ascending order by the results of running each element in a collection thru each iteratee.
This method performs a stable sort, that is, it preserves the original sort order of equal elements.
The iteratees are invoked with one argument: (value).

For usage reference - https://lodash.com/docs#sortBy
classitems.name: sortBy

return.description: Promise resolved with the new sorted array

classitems.description:
Sorts the elements of an array in place via a custom compare function

For usage reference - https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/sort
classitems.name: customCompare

params.name: collection
params.description: The collection to iterate over

params.name: Specifies
params.description: a function that defines the sort order

return.description: Promise resolved with the new sorted array

classitems.description: Utility which runs all passed Promises and returns only once all have been fufilled
classitems.name: runAll

params.name: promisesToRunAn
params.description: array of Promises

return.description: Promise resolved with an array of Promise resolutions

classitems.description:
Modifes each item of a collection returning only the requested properties from each.
Deep picking is not yet supported.
classitems.name: pluckProperties

params.name: collection
params.description: The collection to iterate over

params.name: propertiesToTake
params.description: Array of property names to keep

return.description: Promise resolved with updated collection

classitems.description: Plugin name
classitems.name: pluginName

classitems.description: Plugin type (Core or Vendor)
classitems.name: pluginType

classitems.description: Core system functionality is namespaced under this ETL object
classitems.name: ETL

classitems.description: Provides convient access to the core system config variables
classitems.name: ETL.config

classitems.description: Provides convient access to core logging functionality
classitems.name: ELT.logger

classitems.description:
Convinence method used by plugins to run code in a background web worker thread. A worker
script must exist in the same directory as the plugin itself with a name of Worker.js. The
format of the worker script must match the one defined in the Sort plugin for example
(see src/plugins/core/Sort/Worker.js);
classitems.name: runInWorker
example: var workerMsg = { cmd: 'orderBy', args: [collection, iteratees, orders] };

params.name: workerMsg
params.description:
The message to be passed to the worker. The object contains
two properties; 1) cmd - The command/method to run inside the Worker & 2) args - The
arguments being passed to the methiod defined in command via apply().

return.description: Promise resolved with collection

classitems.description:
Plugin tasks are a series of chained Promises. setupTaskEngine is used to start the chain.
Since the plugin instance itself is an object and not a promise we cannot immediately chain
(then) off it.
classitems.name: runInWorker

return.description: An immediately resolved Promise

classitems.description:
This should be the 2nd method called by a plugin (after setupTaskEngine) when
performing a task.  Takes care of internal proceses required when starting a new
starts.  Might be something as simple as logging or might be more complex.
classitems.name: runInWorker

return.description: An immediately resolved Promise

classitems.description:
This should be the last method called by a plugin (after setupTaskEngine) when
done performing a task.  Takes care of internal proceses required when end a
task.  Might be something as simple as logging or might be more complex.
classitems.name: endTask

return.description: An immediately resolved Promise

classitems.description: Object containing references to core plugins that have loaded in the current program
classitems.name: Plugins.Core

classitems.description: Object containing references to vendor plugins that have loaded in the current program
classitems.name: Plugins.Vendor

classitems.description:
Used to mixin the functionality of a core or 3rd party vendor ETL plugin. These
plugins are located in plugins/core & plugins/vendor.
classitems.name: loadPlugins

params.name: pluginTypes
params.description: Type of plugin being imported (Core or Vendor)

params.name: pluginNames
params.description: Plugin(s) to import
